alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 3:38AM MDT until June 26 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO MONDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River at Fort Morgan. * WHEN...From early this morning to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, There is minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM MDT Friday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM MDT Friday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...Additional rises expected through the weekend with a crest near 18.4 feet by Sunday morning. It will fall below flood stage again Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.9 feet on 06/15/2015. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
